page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape of the area is typical of this part of Devon; predominately that of dairy farming with small hilly fields, ancient hedgerows and lanes. However there are also large areas of (mainly) deciduous woodland on the higher ground, and to the East a common of heath and scrub. The parish is designated as an area of outstanding natural beauty and the village is a conservation area. The village used to be surrounded by apple orchards. Some of these have been felled but several large ones remain. Cider apples are still grown. Many beech trees were planted in the 18th century and the beech woods are an outstanding feature.
